# year()

**Instance Method**

Modifies the ISO 8601 date format style to include the year in the formatted output.

## Declaration

```swift
func year() -> Date.ISO8601FormatStyle
```

## Return Value

An ISO 8601 date format style modified to include the year.

## Discussion

This example shows an ISO 8601 format with, and without, a year.

```swift
let meetingDate = Date() // Jun 23, 2021 at 12:51 PM
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601
    .year()
    .month()
    .day()
) 
// 20210623

meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601
    .month()
    .day()
) 
// 0623
```

The default [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle] includes the year.

For more information about formatting dates, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle].

## Modifying Dates in an ISO 8601 Format Style

- **dateSeparator(_:)**: Modifies the ISO 8601 date format style to use the specified date separator.
- **month()**: Modifies the ISO 8601 date format style to include the month in the formatted output.
- **weekOfYear()**: Modifies the ISO 8601 date format style to include the week of the year in the formatted output.
- **day()**: Modifies the ISO 8601 date format style to include the day in the formatted output.
